page.title: 02CHANGING FACE OF OTTERTON
page.content: Otterton is in the process of changing its character. At one time, the{Clinton Estate}owned almost all the properties in the village, but now they are selling them off to private buyers, who make improvements and often build extensions. This means that the houses in the main street look prettier than they used to. At one time there used to be seven working farms right on the main street each with a tenant farmer and his family. Now, the land is managed from the Estate Office in East Budleigh. The farm-houses are now being sold to private developers for conversion to houses. In addition to this there are several small developments which are filling in some of the old orchards and large gardens near the village centre.
